page.title: 06 OUR SCHOOL COOK.
page.content:
Mrs Thomas is our school cook
and she has been working in Tonna for 9 years.She worked for a year in the old Tonna Junior School and she said that she had more room there and enjoyed it. To be a cook Mrs Thomas had to pass the City of Guilds exam.She starts work at 8 o'clock and finishes at 3 o'clock in the afternoon.She has two people who help.They are Mrs Beynon and Mrs Jones. Mrs Thomas thinks that the type of meal has changed greatly, because now we have a choice of menu. They get their vegetables,fish and sausage from Swansea;Groceries from Cardiff and Meat from Bridgend. A school meal today costs 65 pence which includes a sweet course and a drink.
